data.title: Roman Imperial Coinage
data.meta_description: Roman Imperial Coinage - RIC I, Rome mints
data.text:
RIC # Picture Description Rarity Mint of Lugdunum (Lyon) (i) Dated gold and silver, 14-37 AD AV aureus - RIC I, 1 Tiberius. AD 14-37. AR Denarius (3.75 g, 11h). Lugdunum (Lyon) mint. Struck AD 14-15. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, Laureate head right / TR POT XVI, Tiberius, holding branch and scepter, driving triumphal quadriga right, IMP VII in exergue. RIC I 1; BMC 1 (Image courtesy CNG) R2 AR denarius - RIC I, 2 No image Same as above (RIC 1) bust in silver. R2 AV aureus - RIC I, 3 No image Same as the coin below (RIC 4) but in gold R2 AR denarius - RIC I, 4 Tiberius. AD 14-37. AR Denarius (3.75 g, 11h). Lugdunum (Lyon) mint. Struck AD 15-16. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, Laureate head right / TR POT XVII, Tiberius, holding branch and scepter, driving triumphal quadriga right, IMP VII in exergue. RIC I 4; Lyon 122; RSC 48 (Image courtesy CNG) R2 AV quinarius - RIC I, 5 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Quinarius, Lugdunum, minted 15-16 AD. 14 mm. TI DIVI F  AVGVSTVS Laureate head r. / TR POT  XVII, Victory seated r. on globe, holding wreath with both hands. RIC 93, 5. C. 49. BN II, not. Giard 117, 125c (this specimen). BMC 121, 12 and pl. 22, 4 (these dies). (Image courtesy Baldwin's Auctions Ltd.) R3 AV quinarius - RIC I, 6 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Quinarius, Lugdunum, minted 18-19 AD, AV 3.53 g. 14 mm. TI DIVI F  AVGVSTVS Laureate head r. / TR POT  XX Victory seated r. on globe, holding wreath with both hands. C 50. BMC 14. RIC 6. King 2. (Image courtesy Numismatica Ars Classica) R3 AV quinarius - RIC I, 7 No photo As the coin above (RIC 6), but with XXII on reverse (minted 20-21 AD) R5 AV quinarius - RIC I, 8 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Quinarius, Lugdunum, minted 22-23 AD, AV 3.82 g. 14 mm. TI DIVI F  AVGVSTVS Laureate head r. / TR POT  XXIIII Victory seated r. on globe, holding wreath with both hands. Biaggi 174. BMC 16. BN . C. 52. Fr. 67. Giard 128.2 (these dies). RIC 8. (Image courtesy Baldwin's Auctions Ltd.) R3 AV quinarius - RIC I, 9 No photo As the coin above (RIC 8), but with XXV on reverse (minted 23-24 AD) R3 AV quinarius - RIC I, 10 No photo As the coin above (RIC 8), but with XXVI on reverse (minted 24-25 AD) R4 AV quinarius - RIC I, 11 No photo As the coin above (RIC 8), but with XXVII on reverse (minted 25-26 AD) R4 AV quinarius - RIC I, 12 No photo As the coin above (RIC 8), but with XXVIII on reverse (minted 26-27 AD) R4 AV quinarius - RIC I, 13 No photo As the coin above (RIC 8), but with XXVIIII on reverse (minted 27-28 AD) R5 AV quinarius - RIC I, 14 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Quinarius, Lugdunum, minted 28/29 AD. TI DIVI F  AVGVSTVS Laureate head r. / TR POT  XXX, Victory seated r. on globe, holding wreath with both hands. Lyon 80; Bahrfelt 229; BMCRE 505; BN 1679-80. (Image courtesy CNG) R4 AV quinarius - RIC I, 15 No photo As the coin above (RIC 14), but with XXXI on reverse (minted 29-30 AD) R5 AV quinarius - RIC I, 16 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Quinarius, Lugdunum, minted 30/31 AD, AV 3.92 grams. TI DIVI F  AVGVSTVS Laureate head r. / TR POT  XXXII, Victory seated r. on globe, holding wreath with both hands. RIC 16; Lyon 136. (Image courtesy CNG) R4 AV quinarius - RIC I, 17 No photo As the coin above (RIC 16), but with XXXIII on reverse (minted 31-32 AD) R4 AV quinarius - RIC I, 18 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Quinarius, Lugdunum, minted 32/33 AD, AV 3.91 grams. TI DIVI F  AVGVSTVS Laureate head r. / TR POT  XXXIIII, Victory seated r. on globe, holding wreath with both hands. RIC 18; BMC 24; RCV 1761 var. (Image courtesy Baldwin's Auctions Ltd.) R4 AV quinarius - RIC I, 19 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Quinarius, Lugdunum, minted 33/34 AD AD. 14 mm. TI CAESAR DIVI  AVG F AVGVSTVS, Laureate head r. / TR POT  XXXV Victory seated r. on globe, holding wreath with both hands. BMC 25; RIC 19. (Image courtesy A.Tkalec AG) R4 AV quinarius - RIC I, 20 No photo As the coin above (RIC 19), but with XXXV on reverse (minted 34-35 AD) R4 AV quinarius - RIC I, 21 No photo As the coin above (RIC 19), but with XXXVI on reverse (minted 35-36 AD) R4 AV quinarius - RIC I, 22 No photo As the coin above (RIC 19), but with XXXVII on reverse (minted 36-37 AD) R5 (ii) Undated gold and silver, 14-37 AD AV aureus - RIC I, 24 No photo Same as the coin below (RIC 24) but with a bare bust of Augustus R3 AV aureus - RIC I, 24 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. AV Aureus, Lugdunum 14-16, AV 7.82 g. TI CAESAR DIVI  AVG F AVGVSTVS Laureate head of Tiberius r. / DIVOS AVGVST  DIVI F Laureate head of Augustus r., six-pointed star above. C 3. BMC 29. RIC 24. CBN 1. Calicó 311. (Image courtesy Numismatica Ars Classica) R3 AV aureus - RIC I, 25 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. AV Aureus (19mm, 7.72 gm). Lugdunum (Lyon) mint. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, laureate head right / PONTIF MAXIM, Livia (as Pax) seated right, holding olive-branch and long vertical sceptre; plain chair legs. RIC I 25; BMCRE 30; Cohen 15. (Image courtesy CNG) R2 AR denarius - RIC I, 26 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. AR Denarius (3.71 gm). Lugdunum mint. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, laureate head right / PONTIF MAXIM, Livia as Pax seated right, holding olive branch and long sceptre. RIC I 26; BMCRE 34; BN 16; RSC 16.(Image courtesy CNG) C AV aureus - RIC I, 27 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. AV Aureus (7.68 gm). Lugdunum (Lyon) mint. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, Laureate head right / PONTIF MAXIM Livia (as Pax) seated right, holding reverted spear and branch, feet on footstool; ornate chair legs, triple line below chair. RIC I 27; Lyon 1471 (D112/R103); BMCRE 39 var. (no footstool); Calicó 305a; Cohen -. (Image courtesy CNG) R2 AR denarius - RIC I, 28 Tiberius. AD 14-37. AR Denarius (19mm, 3.52 g, 11h). Lugdunum (Lyon) mint. Group 2, AD 15-18. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, Laureate head right, one wreath tie over shoulder / PONTIF MAXIM, Livia (as Pax) seated right, holding spear and olive-branch; ornate chair legs, two lines below throne. RIC I 28; Lyon 146; RSC 16b. (Image courtesy CNG) S AR denarius - RIC I, 28var Tiberius. AD 14-37. AR Denarius (3.66 g, 2h). Tribute Penny type. Lugdunum (Lyon) mint. Group 3, struck AD 18. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, Laureate head right, one ribbon on shoulder / PONTIF MAXIM, Livia (as Pax) seated right, holding spear and olive branch; ornate chair legs (simplified); two lines below throne. RIC I 28 var. (3 lines below throne); Lyon 148; RSC 16b.(Image courtesy CNG) ? AV aureus - RIC I, 29 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. AV Aureus (7.64 gm). Lugdunum mint. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, laureate head right / PONTIF MAXIM, Livia (as Pax) seated right, holding olive-branch and long vertical sceptre; ornate legs to chair. RIC I 29; BMCRE 46; BN 26; Cohen 15. (Image courtesy CNG) R AV aureus - RIC I, 29var Tiberius. AD 14-37. AV Aureus (7.65 g, 12h). Lugdunum (Lyon) mint. Group 4, AD 18-35. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, laureate large head right, one ribbon on shoulder / PONTIF MAXIM, Livia (as Pax) seated right on chair, holding inverted spear in right hand and olive branch in left, feet on footstool; ornate chair legs, single line below. RIC I 29 var. (scepter); Lyon 149; Calicó 305a; cf. BMCRE 46-47 var. (same); BN 22; Cohen 15. (Image courtesy CNG) ? AR denarius - RIC I, 30 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. AR Denarius "Tribute Penny" (3.71 gm). Lugdunum mint. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, laureate head right / PONTIF MAXIM, Livia, as Pax, seated right, holding olive-branch and long vertical sceptre; ornate legs to chair. RIC I 30; BMCRE 48; RSC 16a. (Image courtesy CNG) C AR denarius - RIC I, 30 var. Tiberius. AD 14-37. AR Denarius (17mm, 3.93 g, 3h). Lugdunum (Lyon) mint. Group 4, struck AD 18-35. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS, Laureate head right, one ribbon on shoulder / PONTIF MAXIM, Livia (as Pax) seated right, holding spear and olive-branch, feet on footstool; ornate chair legs; one line below throne. RIC I 30 var. (scepter); Lyon 150; RSC 16b va. (no footstool). Good VF, lightly-toned. Well-centered and struck. (Image courtesy CNG) ? (iii) undated bronzes, ca.14-21 AD AE dupondius or as - RIC I, - Tiberius. AD 14-37. Æ Dupondius or As (25mm, 12.96 g, 12h). Lugdunum mint (?). Struck circa AD 14-21. TI CAESAR DIVI-AVG F AVGVSTVS, laureate head right / ROM ET AVG, Front elevation of the Altar of Lugdunum, decorated with the corona civica between laurels and stylized figures; Victories on columns. RIC I 31 var. (Image courtesy CNG) ? AE semis - RIC I, 31 Tiberius. AD 14-37. Æ Semis (4.37 g, 4h). Rome mint. Struck circa AD 14-21. TI CAESAR DIVI-AVG F AVGVSTVS, laureate head right / ROM ET AVG, Front elevation of the Altar of Lugdunum, decorated with the corona civica between laurels and stylized figures; Victories on columns. RIC I 31. (Image courtesy CNG) R4 AE quadrans - RIC I, 32 var or corr Tiberius. AD 14-37. Æ Quadrans (3.65 g, 3h). Rome mint. Struck circa AD 14-21. TI CAESAR DIVI-AVG F AVGVSTV, Laureate head right / ROM ET AVG, Front elevation of the Altar of Lugdunum, decorated with the corona civica between laurels and stylized figures; Victories on columns. RIC I 32 var. (bare head). (Image courtesy CNG) R2 Mint of Rome (i) Dated bronzes, sestertii, dupondii and asses, 14-37 AD AE as - RIC I, 33 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ As (28mm, 11.14 gm). Rome mint. Struck 15-16 AD. TI· CAESAR· DIVI· AVG· F· AVGVST· IMP· VII·, Bare head right / PONTIF· MAXIM· TRIBVN· POTEST· XVII , Draped female (Livia) seated right, holding sceptre and patera, S-C in fields. RIC I 33; Cohen 117. (Image courtesy CNG) R3 AE as - RIC I, 34 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ As (27mm, 10.68 gm, 1h). Rome mint. Struck 15-16 AD. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST IMP VII, bare head left / PONT MAXIM TRIBVN POTEST XVII, S C across field, draped female seated right, holding patera and sceptre, feet on footstool; ornate chair legs. RIC I 34; BMCRE 68; Cohen 18. (Image courtesy CNG) S AE as - RIC I, 35 Tiberius. AD 14-37. Æ As (11.31 g, 12h). Rome mint. Struck AD 15-16. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS IMP VII, Bare head right /PONT MAXIM TRIBVN POTEST XVII, Draped female seated right, holding patera and scepter, S-C in fields. RIC I 35. (Image courtesy CNG) R2 AE as - RIC I, 36 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ As (27mm, 10.08 g). Struck 15-16 AD. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVSTVS IMP VII, Bare head left / PONT MAXIM TRIBVN POTEST XVII, Draped female figure seated right, holding patera and sceptre, S-C in fields. RIC I 36; Cohen 17. (Image courtesy CNG) R4 AE as - RIC I, 37 No photo TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ As (about 10g). Struck 15-16 AD. TI· CAESAR· DIVI· AVG· F· AVGVST· IMP· VII·, Bare head right / PONT MAXIM TRIBVN POTEST XVII, wreath above facing chair, S-C in fields. RIC I 36; Cohen 17. (Image courtesy CNG) R4 AE dupondius - RIC I, 38 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ Dupondius. Rome mint. Struck circa 16-22 AD. TI · CAESAR · DIVI · AVG · F · AVGVST · IMP · VIII., Laureate head left / CLEMENTIAE, small bust of Tiberius within laurel wreath; all in the center of a large shield with palmettes and raised petals, S-C in fields. RIC 38. C. 4. BMC 85. CBN 127. (Image courtesy Numismatik Lanz München) S AE dupondius - RIC I, 39 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ Dupondius (30mm, 22.92 g). Rome mint. Struck circa 16-22 AD. TI · CAESAR · DIVI · AVG · F · AVGVST · IMP · VIII., Laureate head left / MODERATIONI, small bust of Tiberius within laurel wreath; all in the center of a large shield with palmettes and raised petals. RIC I 39; BMCRE 90; Cohen 5.(Image courtesy CNG) R AE as - RIC I, 40 Tiberius. AD 14-37. Æ As (31mm, 15.70 g). Rome mint. Struck AD 16-22. TI · CAESAR · DIVI · AVG · F · AVGVST · IMP · VIII., Laureate head left / MODERATIONIS, S-C across field, small bust of Tiberius within laurel wreath; all in the center of a large shield with palmettes and raised petals. RIC I 40; BMCRE 90 var. (MODERATIONI); BN 128; Cohen 6. (Image courtesy CNG) R4 AE as - RIC I, 41 No photo TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ As Rome mint. Struck 20-21 AD. TI· CAESAR· DIVI· AVG· F· AVGVST· IMP· VII·, Bare head right / PONTIF· MAXIM· TRIBVN· POTEST· XXII , Draped female (Livia) seated right, holding sceptre and patera, S-C in fields. (very similar to RIC 33) R4 AE sestertius - RIC I, 42 Tiberius & Germanicus Gemellus. AD 19-37/8 and 19-23/4, respectively. Æ Sestertius (26.79 g, 12h). Rome mint. Struck under Tiberius, AD 22-23. Crossed cornucopia, each surmounted by the bust of a boy, vis-à-vis; winged caduceus between / DRVSVS CAESAR TI AVG F DIVI AVG N PONT TR POT II around large S C. RIC I 42 (Tiberius). (Image courtesy CNG) S AE dupondius - RIC I, 43 Drusus. Caesar, AD 19-23. Æ Dupondius (28mm, 14.71 g, 1h). Rome mint. Struck AD 21-22. PIETAS, Veiled, diademed, and draped bust of Pietas right / SRVSVS CAESAR TI AVGVSTI F TR POT ITER around large S  C. RIC I 43 (Tiberius). (Image courtesy CNG) S AE as - RIC I, 44 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ As (30mm, 11.08 gm). Struck 22-23 AD. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST IMP VIII, head bare left / PONTIF MAXIM TRIBVN POTEST XXIIII around large S C. BMCRE 91. CBN 68. RIC 44. Cohen 25 (5 Fr.). (Image courtesy CNG) C AE as - RIC I, 45 In the name of Drusus, struck by TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ As (30mm, 9.83 gm). Struck 22-23 AD. DRVSVS CAESAR TI AVG F DIVI AVG N, bare head left / PONTIF· TRIBVN· POTEST· ITER around large S C. BMC 134, 99; RIC 45; C. 2; (Image courtesy Jean Elsen & ses Fils S.A.) C AE dupondius - RIC I, 46 Tiberius. AD 14-37. Æ Dupondius (14.53 g, 6h). Rome mint. Struck AD 22-23. IVSTITIA, Draped bust of Justitia right, wearing stephane / TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVG P M TR POT XXIIII .around large S  C. RIC I 46; Vagi 498 (Antonia and/or Agrippina Senior). (Image courtesy CNG) S AE dupondius - RIC I, 47 Julia Augusta (Livia). Augusta, AD 14-29. Æ Dupondius (14.52 g, 12h). Rome mint. Struck under Tiberius, AD 22-23. SALVS  AVGVSTA, bare-headed and draped bust of Julia Augusta (Livia) as Salus Augusta right / TI  CAESAR  DIVI  AVG F  AVG P M TR  POT  XXIIII  around large S  C. RIC I 47 (Tiberius); BMCRE 81-4 (Tiberius); BN 63-7 (Tiberius); Cohen 5.(Image courtesy CNG) S AE sestertius - RIC I, 48 Tiberius. AD 14-37. Æ Sestertius (35mm, 27.71 g, 5h). Rome mint. Struck AD 22-23. CIVITATIBVS ASIAE-RESTITVTIS, Tiberius seated left, holding patera and scepter / TI  CAESARI  DIVI  AVG F  AVGVST P M TR  POT  XXIIII  around large S  C RIC I 48. (Image courtesy CNG) S AE sestertius - RIC I, 49 DIVUS AUGUSTUS. Died 14 AD. Æ Sestertius (25.21 gm). Rome mint. Struck under Tiberius, circa 22-23 AD. DIVVS AVGVSTVS  PATER Augustus, radiate, seated l., feet on stool, holding laurel branch and long sceptre; in front, altar / TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST P M TR POT XXIIII round S C. C RIC I 49 (Tiberius); BMCRE 74 (Tiberius); Cohen 309. (Image courtesy CNG) R AE sestertius - RIC I, 49 No photo DIVUS AUGUSTUS. Died 14 AD. Æ Sestertius (25.21 gm). Rome mint. Struck under Tiberius, circa 22-23 AD. S P Q R/IVLIAE AVGVST, Ornamented carpentum drawn right by pair of mules / TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST P M TR POT XXIIII round S C. C RIC I 49 (Tiberius); BMCRE 74 (Tiberius); Cohen 309. (Image courtesy CNG) R AE sestertius - RIC I, 51 LIVIA, wife of Augustus and mother of Tiberius. Augusta, 14-29 AD. Æ Sestertius (26.73 gm). Rome mint. Struck under Tiberius, 22-23 AD. S P Q R/IVLIAE/AVGVST, Ornamented carpentum drawn right by pair of mules / Legend around large S C. RIC I 51 (Tiberius); MIR 2, 34-4; BMCRE 76 (Tiberius); Cohen 6. (Image courtesy CNG) S AE as - RIC I, 52 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. As circa 34-35, æ 10.99 g. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST IMP VIII Laureate head l. / PONTIF MAX TR POT XXXVI S  C Rudder placed vertically across banded globe; small globe at base of rudder. C 12 (misdescribed). BMC 104. CBN 89. RIC 52. (Image courtesy Numismatica Ars Classica) R2 AE as - RIC I, 53 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ As (28mm, 10.70 gm). Rome mint. Struck 34-35 AD. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST IMP VIII, Laureate head of Tiberius left / PONTIF MAXIM TRIBVN POTEST XXXVI / S - C, Winged caduceus. RIC I 53; Cohen 21 (Image courtesy CNG) R2 AE sestertius - RIC I, 54 No photo TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ Sestertius. Struck 34-35 AD. Empty horse-drawn quadriga right, its side panels decorated with Victory and captives / TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST P M TR POT XXXVI around large S C. R2 AE sestertius - RIC I, 55 No photo TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Sestertius, 34-35 A.D. Rome.The Temple of Concordia: Concordia seated left on throne, holding patera and sceptre, above altar within hexastyle façade set on podium; entrance flanked by statues of Hercules and Mercury; pediment decorated with statues of Jupiter, Juno, Minerva, and Victories in acroteria; wings of transverse cella with windows behind; pediments decorated with statues / TI. CAESAR DIVI AVG. F. AVGVST. P.M. TR.POT. XXXVI around SC. RIC 55. R3 AE sestertius - RIC I, 56 DIVUS AUGUSTUS. 27 BC-14 AD. Æ Sestertius (36mm, 24.48 gm). Struck under Tiberius, circa 35-36 AD. Augustus, radiate and holding laurel branch and sceptre, seated left in quadriga pulled by four elephants, each with a rider / TI. CAESAR DIVI AVG. F. AVGVST. P.M. TR.POT. XXXVI Legend around SC. RIC I 56 (Tiberius); BMCRE 102 (Tiberius); Cohen 306. (Image courtesy CNG) R3 AE sestertius - RIC I, 57 No photo DIVUS AUGUSTUS. 27 BC-14 AD. Æ Sestertius. Struck under Tiberius, circa 35-36 AD. DIVO AVGVSTI SPQR, OB/CIVIS/SER in three lines across shield bordered by oak wreath; shield supported by two capricorns set on globe / TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST PM TR POT XXXVII around large S C across field / TI. CAESAR DIVI AVG. F. AVGVST. P.M. TR.POT. XXXVI Legend around SC. RIC I 56 (Tiberius); BMCRE 102 (Tiberius); Cohen 306. (Image courtesy CNG) R4 AE as - RIC I, 58 Tiberius. AD 14-37. Æ As (25mm, 10.65 g, 8h). Rome mint. Struck AD 35-36. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST IMP VIII, Laureate head left / PONTIF MAX TR POT XXXVII, S - C, flanking rudder and large globe; smaller globe to right of rudder. RIC I 58. (Image courtesy CNG) R2 AE as - RIC I, 59 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ As (11.15 gm). Rome mint. Struck 35-36 AD. Laureate head left / Winged caduceus. RIC I 59; MIR 2, 49-6; BMCRE 120; Cohen 22. (Image courtesy CNG) C AE sestertius - RIC I, 60 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ Sestertius (27.74 gm). Struck 35/36 AD. Empty horse-drawn quadriga right, its side panels decorated with Victory and captives / TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST P M TR POT XXXVII around large S C. RIC I 60; BMCRE 113; BN 91; Cohen 66. (Image courtesy CNG) R AE sestertius - RIC I, 61 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ Sestertius (27.19 gm, 6h). Rome mint. Struck 35-36 AD. The Temple of Concordia: Concordia seated left on throne, holding patera and sceptre, above altar within hexastyle façade set on podium; entrance flanked by statues of Hercules and Mercury; pediment decorated with statues of Jupiter, Juno, Minerva, and Victories in acroteria; wings of transverse cella with windows behind; pediments decorated with statues / Legend around large S C. RIC I 61; BMCRE 116; (Image courtesy CNG) R2 AE sestertius - RIC I, 62 Divus Augustus. Died AD 14. Æ Sestertius (19.97 g, 1h). Rome mint. Struck under Tiberius, AD 35-36. DIVO/AVGVSTO/S P Q R in left field, Statue of Augustus, holding branch and scepter, seated left on throne set on ornate car drawn by four elephants; each elephant has its own mahout / Legend around large S C. RIC I 62 (Tiberius). (Image courtesy Numismatica Ars Classica) R AE sestertius - RIC I, 63 DIVUS AUGUSTUS. Died 14 AD. Æ Sestertius (25.76 gm). Rome mint. Struck under Tiberius, 35-36 AD. DIVO AVGVSTI SPQR, OB/CIVIS/SER in three lines across shield bordered by oak wreath; shield supported by two capricorns set on globe / TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST PM TR POT XXXVII around large S C across field. RIC I 63 (Tiberius); MIR 2, 54-4; BMCRE 109 (Tiberius); Cohen 303 (Augustus). (Image courtesy CNG) R2 AE as - RIC I, 64 Tiberius. AD 14-37. Æ As (10.70 g, 8h). Rome mint. Struck AD 36-37. TI CAESAR  DIVI  AVG  F  AVGVST  IMP  VIII, laureate head left / PONTIF MAX  TR  above, POT  XXXIIX below, S C across field, rudder placed vertically across diagonally banded globe; small globe at base of rudder. RIC I 64; BMCRE 136-137; BN 123; Cohen 14 corr. (TRIBVN POTEST instead of TR POT). (Image courtesy CNG) S AE as - RIC I, 65 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ As (29mm, 12.30 g). Rome mint. Struck 36-37 AD. TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST IMP VIII , Laureate head left / PONTIF MAXIM TRIBVN POTEST XXXIIX, Winged caduceus. RIC I 65; BMCRE 138; Cohen 22. (Image courtesy CNG) R AE sestertius - RIC I, 66 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ Sestertius (28.11 gm). Rome mint. Struck 36-37 AD. Empty quadriga right; chariot ornamented with trophy, Victory with trophy, and captive / TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST P M TR POT XXXIIX around large S C. RIC I 66; MIR 2, 56-4; BMCRE 130; Cohen 67. (Image courtesy CNG) R AE sestertius - RIC I, 67 TIBERIUS. 14-37 AD. Æ Sestertius (28.50 gm). Rome mint. Struck 36-37 AD. The Temple of Concordia: Concordia seated left on throne, holding patera and sceptre, above altar within hexastyle façade set on podium; entrance flanked by statues of Hercules and Mercury; pediment decorated with statues of Jupiter, Juno, Minerva, and Victories in acroteria; wings of transverse cella with windows behind; pediments decorated with statues / TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST P M TR POT XXXIIX, Legend around large S C. RIC I 67; MIR 2, 58-4; BMCRE 133; Cohen 70 corr. (Temple of Divus Augustus). (Image courtesy CNG) S AE sestertius - RIC I, 68 DIVUS AUGUSTUS. Died 14 AD. Æ Sestertius (33mm, 24.03 g, 7h). Rome mint. Struck under Tiberius, circa 36-37 AD. DIVO/AVGVSTO/S P Q R in left field, statue of Augustus seated left on throne, holding laurel branch in right hand and sceptre in left hand, set on ornate car drawn by four elephants; each elephant has its own mahout / TI CAESAR DIVI AVG F AVGVST P M TR POT XXXIIX, large S C across field. RIC I 68 (Tiberius); BMCRE 125 (Tiberius); Cohen 308. (Image courtesy CNG) R AE sestertius - RIC I, 69 DIVUS AUGUSTUS. Died 14 AD. Æ Sestertius (27.79 grams). Rome mint. Struck under Tiberius, 36-37 AD.
